sourceMeaningMnemonic: There are some <radical>shellfish</radical> in a <radical>net</radical> that you can <kanji>buy</kanji>. You can't just buy loose shellfish. You can only buy the ones that are in the net, bagged up and ready for your money.
meaningInfo: Imagine looking over a bunch of different kinds of shellfish wrapped in nets. Think about which ones you want to buy.
readingMnemonic: You decide to <kanji>buy</kanji> as many shellfish as you can fit in your <reading>ca</reading>r (<ja>か</ja>). You keep buying until your car is completely full of shellfish before you stop. Cars are totally a realistic unit of measure.
readingInfo: Imagine buying an entire car's worth of shellfish. Mmm delicious.
